pullRequest.body:
Extend the results in `Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/BilinearForm/TensorProduct.lean` from Bilinear Forms to Bilinear Maps

Similarly for `LinearAlgebra/QuadraticForm/TensorProduct`.

I had originally intended to extend much more, but was blocked by not being able to extend `LinearMap.IsSymm` from forms to maps.

---

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

- ...

Deletions:

- ...

will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

-->

<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

This looks quite similar to [LinearEquiv.congrRight](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Module/Equiv/Basic.html#LinearEquiv.congrRight); I think we can use that to implement this?

Thanks. Done. In a similar vein, we can also implement `LinearMap.BilinForm.congr` as:
```
def congr (e : M â‰ƒâ‚—[R] M') : BilinForm R M â‰ƒâ‚—[R] BilinForm R M' :=
  LinearEquiv.congrRight (LinearEquiv.congrLeft _ _ e) â‰ªâ‰«â‚— LinearEquiv.congrLeft _ _ e
```
I've pushed a separate commit with this, but perhaps there are reasons why it was previously done directly? (Performance?)

```suggestion
/-- When `Nâ‚` and `Nâ‚‚` are equivalent, quadratic maps on `M` into `Nâ‚` are equivalent to quadratic
```
Must be an artifact. Removed now, thanks.

Could you split this and the corresponding `BilinForm.congrâ‚‚` to their own PR?

It would be good to have the
```lean
@[simp]
theorem congr_refl : congr (.refl R N) = .refl R (QuadraticMap R M N) := rfl

theorem congr_symm (e : N â‰ƒâ‚—[R] P) : congr e.symm = (congr e (M := M)).symm := rfl
```
lemmas for this definition as well, like we do for `BilinForm`.

I also wonder if `LinearEquiv.congrQuadraticMap` would be a better name to match `LinearMap.compQuadraticMap`.

pullRequest.title: refactor(LinearAlgebra/BilinearForm/TensorProduct): Tensor products of bilinear maps
